3.69. 
Surnames of former spouses 
1. A spouse may retain his/her married name or the name he/she had before the marriage after the divorce. 
2. If the marriage has been dissolved through the fault of one of the spouses, the court may, at the request of the other spouse, prohibit the spouse who is at fault for the dissolution of the marriage from retaining his/her married name, unless the spouses have children in common.
